\[
\begin{align*}
(p > q) > r &\equiv (!p | q) > r\\
&\equiv!(!p | q) | r\\
&\equiv (p &!q) | r\\
\end{align*}
\]

\[
\begin{align*}
p > (q > r) &\equiv p > (!q | r)\\
&\equiv!p | (!q | r)\\
&\equiv!p |!q | r
\end{align*}
\]

It is clear that \((p &!q) | r\) is not equivalent to \(!p |!q | r\). So the answer is [[B]].
